articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem
articles.description: Eight Palestinians were killed and dozens wounded when Israeli forces bombarded several areas of Khan Younis and Rafah in the southern Gaza Strip, health officials said on Tuesday, as thousands of people fled their homes under fire.
articles.title: Thousands flee their homes as Israeli forces bomb southern Gaza

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hurricane Beryl barrelled across the Atlantic Ocean toward the Caribbean's Windward Islands as an "extremely dangerous" storm on Monday, threatening to devastate communities with floods, storm surges and life-threatening high winds, officials said.
articles.title: 'Extremely dangerous' Hurricane Beryl hurtles towards Caribbean

articles.author: Dan Peleschuk
articles.description: Explosions reverberated across the pre-dawn sky as Ukrainian air defences fended off a Russian attack on this small city in western Ukraine, home to an important air base and a frequent target of Moscow's strikes.
articles.title: Ukrainian air base under fire as Russia aims at F-16 arrivals

articles.author: Aaron Ross, Jefferson Kahinju
articles.description: Riot police patrolled Kenya's capital Nairobi on Tuesday morning as young activists called for more protests following last week's deadly clashes.
articles.title: Riot police patrol Nairobi as Kenyan activists call for more protests

articles.author: Sudip Kar-Gupta, Dominique Vidalon
articles.description: Opponents of France's National Rally stepped up their bid to block the far-right party from power on Tuesday as more candidates said they would bow out of this weekend's run-off election to avoid splitting the anti-RN vote.
articles.title: French candidates bow out in concerted bid to block far-right

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 27 people have died in a stampede at a religious event in India's northern state of Uttar Pradesh on Tuesday, authorities said.
articles.title: At least 27 dead in stampede at religious event in north India

articles.author: Suban Abdulla, Temilade Adelaja
articles.description: Voting for the first time in a British election, Prathesh Panjak and other immigrant voters are excited to take part in the July 4 ballot, hoping they can influence change in the country that they have chosen to call home.
articles.title: UK election gives hope to first time immigrant voters

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippines told China it will be "relentless" in protecting its interests and upholding its sovereignty, sovereign rights, and jurisdiction in the South China Sea, its foreign ministry said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Philippine says to be 'relentless' in protecting interests in South China Sea

articles.author: Tora Agarwala
articles.description: Heavy rain continued to trigger flood and landslides in India's north and north-east, killing at least 11 people and affecting hundreds of thousands, officials from two affected states said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Heavy rainfall in several parts of India triggers floods, at least 11 dead

articles.author: Sofia Christensen
articles.description: Arouna Loure, a vocal critic of Burkina Faso's ruling military junta, received a conscription order on Sept. 7 last year requesting that the anaesthesiologist start a month of military service four days later.
articles.title: Insight: How Burkina Faso's junta is conscripting critics to fight Islamist rebels
